name: South Street (Cassandra New South Street)
description: South Street is one of the more active streets in Cassandra, blending social gathering spots, religious presence, and everyday commerce. It is a place where townsfolk regularly cross paths, making it an important social artery and a frequent destination for investigators.

snapshot.name: South Street
snapshot.description: South Street carries a steady flow of people throughout the day and night. The atmosphere shifts noticeably depending on the time: lively and noisy near the bar in the evenings, subdued and contemplative near the church, and practical and utilitarian around the hardware store. This mix gives the street a layered social texture, where casual conversations, rumors, and routine activities coexist.

conditions.description: Mixed ambient noise: voices and laughter near the bar, quieter footsteps and murmurs near the church.
Alcohol and food smells from the bar mingle with dust and metal scents from the hardware store.

exits.description: A popular local bar and the site of THE SECOND MURDER CASE (December 22, 2003): 21-year-old Aberforth Locefern (Lucifero) killed by gunshot and knife—exactly one year after the first case at Paradil Grand Hotel.
A place of worship standing prominently along South Street, offering a stark contrast to the nearby bar.
A practical shop selling tools and supplies, frequented by townsfolk for everyday needs.

snapshot.keeperNotes: South Street is ideal for overlapping leads. The Reindeer Bar here is the site of THE SECOND MURDER CASE (December 22, 2003—21-year-old Lucifero, gunshot/stab), exactly one year after THE FIRST CASE at Paradil Grand Hotel (December 22, 2002—19-year-old girl, frozen in ice). Investigators can easily move between social, religious, and practical locations, allowing rumors, witnesses, and tension to intersect naturally.

connections.description: South Street provides direct access to the Reindeer Bar and its central murder investigation.
Investigators can enter the church directly from South Street to pursue religious or cult-related leads.
The hardware store branches off South Street and may support practical preparations or minor leads.
